chunks.en: Today, I accidentally used the rsync command on a Linux server and deleted the /root directory of a hard drive with ext4 and xfs formats...ğŸ˜­
The hard drive has been unmounted.
Emergency help needed!!!
There are AI police here too. This kind of bad person is the type who gets beaten up in school and likes to tell the teacher. Whoever encounters this kind of person in reality is really unlucky.
@tagtag Haha, it's like the Japanese are here. Two progressive people are arguing about who will be the first to play the role of a guide. It's hilarious.

It's possible elsewhere, but who here doesn't know how to use AI? ChatGPT is available anonymously, and there are plenty of domestic ones. Besides, that long, stinky paragraph above, he probably didn't even look at it before copy-pasting it.
There are just some people in this world who are unwilling to help others search on Baidu, but are happy to report them.ğŸ˜
@Livid #2 AI
@caiyuyu #19 Who doesn't know how to ask AI? Do you need to paste the answer here and pollute the environment?
It's just that some people don't know how to ask AI. Someone kindly helped answer, which also shows that those who clamor to report AI-generated content probably tattled a lot in school.

@Lirika This isn't a matter of whether it's worth it or not, it's a matter of awareness. His answer only shows enthusiasm, but it can't directly help the original poster solve the problem. It's like someone who can't swim teaching a parent who can't swim to go into the water to save their child. In comparison, if the data is very important, the suggestion from many people upstairs to spend money to find a professional to recover it is more reliable.

chunks.en: @Livid Add a warning message to the input box placeholder prohibiting AI replies. It's possible some people don't even know about it.
@PROJECT #84 Your statement here is very politically correct and righteous, but your reply in #32 makes you look like a clown.
@PROJECT Is it necessary? Someone kindly posted a record, it wasn't intentional, why do you have to report them?
@Livid #2 AI reply

@liuzemin0607 This isn't an issue of AI police, it's mainly about posting something long, stinky, and unverified. It's no different from those who used to copy and paste long jokes in the comments to flood the forum.

chunks.en: @Livid Can you be completely banned for posting an AI answer? That's too much. At least give a warning.
@caiyuyu You like to go against the grain. Before, the administrator directly deleted accounts without an announcement, which I felt was inappropriate. Now it's announced.
![1738999151962.png]( https://s1.locimg.com/2025/02/08/9200b12c376b1.png) OP, don't bother. The value of your data is probably not as high as the cost of recovering it.
In the event of such a major accident, report to the leadership immediately for lenient treatment.
Before, we had a guy in our group who deleted data, not life-threatening data, but it was like that.
@PROJECT #18 @Livid I suggest making the guidelines against directly using AI replies more obvious. Many users may not know this rule, even long-time users.
Or, a one-week ban for the first offense, and a permanent ban for the second offense. To err is human, especially when unaware.
@mingtdlb #27 In the beginning, it seems the administrator posted an announcement prohibiting this, but many people didn't see it. There's a prompt when creating a new topic, but not when replying.
So, many people may still not know this rule.
Many people are stunned when they get banned, and only find out about the rule after being banned, but it's too late.
I've already blocked some people in advance, it feels like they're the type to report colleagues for slacking off.
At least give a warning, ban on the second offense. Banning without warning isn't appropriate... @Livid

@PROJECT #18 Looking at his other replies, he basically didn't use AI. You're reporting someone as an AI police even when he himself is unaware. You're probably the type in reality who sucks up to the boss and engages in internal strife with colleagues. Stay far away when you encounter this kind of person.
